thread.title: Van den Ham misses podium by one second
thread.title_full: Van den Ham misses podium by one second

title: Van den Ham misses podium by one second
text:
Van den Ham misses podium by one second By: Uncredited Report Error 
One second was the difference from Michael van den Ham standing on the podium and missing it at the Canadian cyclo-cross championships in Winnipeg on Saturday. 
The Brandonite finished his eight laps in one hour two minutes and 45 seconds, but it was only good enough for fourth place in the elite men’s competition. Aaron Schooler of Edmonton was one second faster to take the bronze medal. Van den Ham’s teammate, Raphael Gagne of Quebec City, topped the field at 1:02:35. 
Van den Ham’s brother, Doug, who now lives in Ottawa, placed third in the master men’s event for riders at least 30 years of age. He completed his five laps in 45:25.
